transcript:
greet- ing the Tsar with the strains of the march, and then "Hurrah!" . . . Then the general march, and again "Hurrah! Hurrah!" growing ever 
stronger and fuller and merging into a deafen- ing roar. 
Till the Tsar reached it, each regiment in its silence and immobility seemed like a lifeless body, but as soon as he came up it became alive, its thunder joining the roar of the whole line along which he had already passed. Through the terrible and deafening roar of those voices, amid the sq
